title: Reduce cardinality of data sent to InfluxDB
body:
K6 appears to generate very high cardinality data.

```
> show tag keys from "http_req_duration";
name: http_req_duration
tagKey
------
group
iter
method
name
ocsp_status
perf_type
proto
status
tls_version
url
vu
```

This is a lot of tags! And a few of them have very high cardinality (largely `iter`, but `vu` is not great either). This very quickly leads to a lot of series:

```
> show series from "http_req_duration" limit 20;
key
---
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=1
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=2
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=3
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=4
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=5
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=6
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=7
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=8
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=0,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=9
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=1
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=2
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=3
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=4
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=5
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=6
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=7
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=8
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=1,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=9
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=10,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=1
http_req_duration,group=::basic\ test\ 1,iter=10,method=GET,name=Ex2-Basic1,proto=HTTP/1.1,status=200,url=http://test.loadimpact.com,vu=2
```

I was testing out k6 and very quickly hit my InfluxDB max series limit after about 10 minutes of benchmarking.

Currently I'm looking to use telegraf to exclude some of these fields, but it would be great if k6 supported choosing a few options:

1. Which of the default key-value pairs are fields vs tags.
2. Which default key-value pairs are used at all.
3. Which default metrics are used.

(1) alone will solve my actual issue, but the others would be nice :) Other than this issue have been very impressed with k6!
